result.execSummary:
The defendant Keenan J Bethly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence with Huber privileges for employment.
Probation can be terminated after six months if defendant is compliant with all terms of probation and agent approves.

miscConds.notes: -Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court finds the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Court grants expungement upon successful completion of all terms of the sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keenan J Bethly

records.addlTxt: Bond applied in error, judgment is still due and owing.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Court finds the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  
Court grants expungement upon successful completion of all terms of the sentence

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the State, Defense counsel and defendant.

Court sentenced defendant to serve  4  MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence with Huber privileges for employment; credit for  1 (one) day served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for  12  MONTHS with the following conditions:
-  Probation can be terminated after six months if defendant is compliant with all terms of probation and agent approves

- Follow all rules of probation.
- No further violations of the law.
- Maintain employment 
- Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Keenan J Bethly in court with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY to the amended charges.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty of the amended charge and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Jury trial is vacated.
Clerk:  jms

State files Amended Information with the court:

Count 1:  Obstructing/Resisting An Officer, a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. 946.41(1), 939.51(3)(a)

Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated January 19, 2016 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Keenan J Bethly in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State's essential witness out of the country on vacation.  State moves to adjourn; defense moves to dismiss.  Court grants State's motion to adjourn and denies defense motion to dismiss.  Jury trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.
State's Witness List received and filed.

Defendant Keenan J Bethly in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  State withdraws their offer.  No further negotations will be accepted.  Matter to remain calendared for Jury Trial on 9-16-2015.
Justice Point Report

Defendant Keenan J Bethly in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Megan Patricia Carmody for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant have uncertainty about pleading to this case.  State's amended information is withdrawn.  Matter calendared for Jury Trial and Final Pretrial  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Keenan J Bethly in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  
Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Defendant in compliance with Jutice Point at this time.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial, received and filed.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 03/24/2015 received and filed. (16 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Atty. Mary Garvin-Guimont, 819 North 6th Street, 9th Floor, Milwaukee, WI, 53203.

Defendant Keenan J Bethly in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.   Thomas Potter for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time. Case was incorrectly tabbed and was reassigned to the correct branch: Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Keenan J Bethly in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Chaperon-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Progarm Report dated 3/23/15.
css
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  No action by the court at this time, will address at next court appearance.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Keenan J Bethly in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Keenan J Bethly in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
